definitions.example: She gave the flowers a quick sniff to check they were real.

definitions.definition: A quantity of something that is inhaled through the nose
A brief perception, or tiny amount.
To make a short, audible inhalation, through the nose, as when smelling something.
definitions.example: I sniffed the meat to see whether it had gone off.

definitions.definition: To say something while sniffing, for example in case of illness or unhappiness, or in contempt.
definitions.example: "He's never coming back, is he?" she sniffed while looking at a picture of him.
I can sniff trouble coming from the basement.

definitions.definition: To be dismissive or contemptuous of something.
definitions.example: This opportunity is not to be sniffed at.

definitions.definition: To intercept and analyse packets of data being transmitted over a network.
To inhale drugs in powder form (usually cocaine) through the nose.
A short inhalation sound, sometimes associated with crying.
